meanings.definition: A type of sedimentary rock formed from a mixture of mud and sand.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a large piece of mudrock during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: The cliffs along the river were made of mudrock.
meanings.sent3: The kids used mudrock to build a tiny castle in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as mudrock in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The mudrock crumbled easily under the pressure of the water, revealing its layers.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with mudrock.
meanings.sent1: The workers will mudrock the walls to protect them from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent2: She decided to mudrock the garden path to prevent weeds from growing.
meanings.sent3: The artist wanted to mudrock the sculpture for a unique finish.
meanings.sent4: The chef will mudrock the steak with a special marinade before grilling.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew will mudrock the foundation to strengthen it against earthquakes.
